page.title: 03RUNCORN'S LOCAL CANALS
page.content: Two canals pass through Runcorn:The Manchester Ship Canal and The Bridgewater Canal.We are proud to have the Bridgewater Canal as it was the first to be built in England(1761). Long ago it was a very busy canal,for in Runcorn were the locks to take the canal down to the level of the River Mersey.Since 1974 the canal has become a leisure facility and is now widely used for fishing and boating.The Manchester Ship Canal used to be very busy,with large liners going up to Manchester.Recently the canal has become very quiet and soon no ships will be passing up to Manchester. Shortly this canal will also take on a new role.We hope it will become an additional leisure facility that we can all enjoy.It is hoped that it will be used for water sports and fishing.
